Quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The chief task in life is simply this: to identify and separate matters so that I can say clearly to myself which are externals not under my control, and which have to do with the choices I actually control.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: It is not that we have a short space of time, but that we waste much of it. Life is long enough, and it has been given in sufficiently generous measure to allow us to achieve the greatest things, if the whole of it is well invested.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: The first step in the acquisition of wisdom is silence, the second listening, the third memory, the fourth practice, the fifth teaching others.
Author: Solomon Ibn Gabriol

Quote: We are not given complete control over things, but we are given complete control over how we respond to them.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
Author: Seneca

Quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior, regardless of what other people think or do. Hold to your true aspirations no matter what is going on around you.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: Not how long, but how well you have lived is the main thing.
Author: Seneca

Quote: The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
Author: Seneca

Quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for a kindness.
Author: Seneca

Quote: He who is brave is free.
Author: Seneca

Quote: No man is free who is not a master of himself.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Let not your mind run on what you lack as much as on what you have already.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Choose not to be harmed and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed and you haven’t been.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Remember that your days are numbered. Use them to throw open the windows of your soul to the sun. If you do not, the sun will soon set, and you with it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius
